subject: RE: [junit] testing private methods
msgSnippet: ... From: David Stagner [mailto:dstagner@nmdp.org] Sent: Friday, March 29, 2002 2:58 PM To: junit@yahoogroups.com Subject: Re: [junit] testing private methods
messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: David Stagner [mailto:dstagner@...]
Sent: Friday, March 29, 2002 2:58 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] testing private methods

>You're not doubling the size of your code - you're doubling the size of
>the source files, by eliminating the separate test files. I think that's
>a non-argument, or as an argument, comes dangerously close to "I'm too
>busy writing code to write tests".

??? My argument is simply "I don't like having source files that are twice
as long as they need to be." How does that come close to "I'm too busy
writing code to write tests?"

-tim
